title: Article 42: Presumption of conformity with certain requirements | AI Act Service Desk
text:
```markdown # Article 42: Presumption of conformity with certain requirements ## Chapter III: High-Risk AI Systems ### Section 5: Standards, Conformity Assessment, Certificates, Registration #### Summary High-risk AI systems trained and tested on data relevant to their intended use are presumed to comply with the requirements of [Article 10(4)](/en/ai-act/article-10) on datasets. Additionally, systems certified under a cybersecurity scheme pursuant to Regulation (EU) 2019/881 are presumed to comply with the cybersecurity requirements of [Article 15](/en/ai-act/article-15), to the extent covered by the certification. The summaries are meant to provide helpful explanation but are not legal binding. #### Relevant Recitals * [Recital 77](/en/ai-act/recital-77) * [Recital 78](/en/ai-act/recital-78) * [Recital 122](/en/ai-act/recital-122) View the [official text](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/HTML/?uri=OJ:L_202401689). The text used in this tool is the ‘[Artificial Intelligence Act (Regulation (EU) 2024/1689), Official version of 13 June 2024](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/HTML/?uri=OJ:L_202401689)’. --- **AI Act Service Desk** This site is managed by: Directorate-General for Communications Networks, Content and
